My training is in law, and I worked as a securities lawyer at a major international firm and in-house at two multinational semiconductor manufacturers before setting up in solo practice.  I’m a consultant and corporate trainer, teaching business acumen to employees of world-class companies.

I have been writing fiction since 2010. I write speculative fiction (fantasy, science fiction, space opera, steampunk, cyberpunk, superhero, alternate history, dystopian fiction, horror and related genres) for all audiences. I have written and am writing novels for middle grade, young adult and adult readers. I’m published by Knopf (The Kidnap Plot), WordFire Press (City of the Saints, Rock Band Fights Evil, The Buza System), and Baen (Witchy Eye). I am also Acquisitions Editor at WordFire.

body.name: ENOMILY
body.bio: I’m somewhere in between it all.

body.name: Copyright Challenges for Musicians in the Digital Era
body.bio:
The panel will focus on the copyright challenges faced by musicians in the digital era. Specifically, the discussion will surround how musicians obtain a copyright and how to enforce those copyrights under the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. 

Moderator: Brad Frazer of Hawley Troxell

Panelists:
Kevin Erickson of the Future of Music Coalition
Rachael Bickerton of Boise State University
Tentative Michael Bunnell, Owner of Record Exchange

body.name: Up in Smoke: Exploring Smoked Cocktails
body.bio: Boise bars are all about smoked cocktails these days. Join some of the city's best craft cocktail bartenders for a look at this trend and sample some of their smoky concoctions. Featuring Buffalo Trace bourbon.

body.name: ELDREN
body.bio:
Eldren has been slaying the Denver music scene for the last six years, and they have just completed two successful west coast tours, playing in 32 new cities in 2016, including the Olympic in Boise.  Eldren won Best Psych Rock Band in Denver two years in a row for the 2016 and 2015 Westword Music Awards, and they have been nominated five times for Best Band in Denver by iHeartRADIO (KTCL 93.3 in Denver) for the Hometown for the Holidays and Big Gig contests.  Their latest album, Welcome to Deathville (2015), made the Colorado Public Radio OpenAir Best Albums of 2015 Listener Poll, and it was given a perfect album review score ("5 out of 5 Cocks") in Rooster Magazine.

Eldren headlines sold out shows in Denver and their genre-bending style allows them to play with a diverse range of musicians.  They have played shows with Gene Ween, OK Go, The Black Angels, Imagine Dragons, Dr. Dog, Cold War Kids, Mother Mother, Cursive, MarchFourth Marching Band, Dan Deacon, and many more.

Praise for Eldren:

"A psychedelic dream rock super pop soundgasm that will grip your eyes and ears and leave you trembling with a sense of wonder and want."
—Westword Magazine

"Eldren, a self-proclaimed 'psychedelic space pop' outfit, represents everything great still left in the world."
—Brian Frederick (Rooster Magazine)

"With a panoply of conventional and not-so-conventional instruments on stage, Eldren draws plenty of attention before the band ever plays a note. Once the group starts playing, it becomes clear that it’s more than just a feast for the eyes. The ensemble’s mashup of jazz, prog rock, jam, power pop, indie rock and more makes for a joyful noise that would be utterly chaotic if it weren’t so damned catchy."
—Eryc Eyl (Denver Post)

body.name: Storyfort/Stonecrop Microfiction Contest Winners
body.bio:
The winners of the Storyfort/Stonecrop Microfiction Contest will be reading their winning entries! 
ENTER HERE - https://stonecropmag.submittable.com/submit/52603/storyforts-micro-fiction-contest-2018-open-to-all
THE RULES!
1. Stories must begin with one of the following first lines (omit artist and song title from submission): 
"I don't give a damn about my bad reputation." ("Bad Reputation" Joan Jett)
"When I was a young girl I used to see pleasure." ("When I Was a Young Girl" Nina Simone)
"I don't think it's going to happen anymore." ("Twenty-One" The Cranberries)
"Some things cost more than you realize." ("All I Need" Radiohead)
"Eddie waited til he finished high school." ("Into the Great Wide Open" Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers)
2. Each entry must be between 300 and 500 words in length. Strictly enforced.
3. $5 reading fee for each entry; 3 entries max.
4. Each piece submitted must be a completely resolved and compelling story (in 300-500 words).
5. All submissions are anonymous. Name and contact details must not appear on the stories.
6. All judging is anonymous. The judges' verdict is final. No correspondence will be entered into.
Prizes (non-transferable):
1st place: 5-day Treefort pass
2nd place: Weekend 2-day Treefort pass
3rd place: Storyfort shirt and SWAG

*All winning submissions will be published in Stonecrop Magazine's Issue 06, Spring 2018. All winners are invited to read winning submissions on the final day of Storyfort. 
*No submissions accepted from staff or organizers of Treefort Music Fest, Storyfort, Duck Club, or Stonecrop Magazine.

body.name: Deviant Kin
body.bio:
"Deviant Kin has become something of a Boise institution.  Fronted by multi-instrumentalist and Renaissance man Steve Baker and featuring a line up of Boise's most talented musicians, Deviant Kin has something for everyone.  Genre bending and original, they seamlessly move through the musical landscape ranging from the bluegrass of the Appalachians to songs that bring up thoughts of the Basque country.  A uniquely Idaho band, Deviant Kin sings Irish folk songs that get the crowd roused and brings it back home with humor celebrating what's best about this state.  Blistering fiddle lines meld with clean banjo rolls held together by one of Boise's tightest rhythm sections.  Deviant Kin will surprise some, impress many, and may even inspire you to become one with your inner shepherd.  Go check them out!"
--Radio DJ Willy Dallas, Host of the AM Breakdown on Radio Boise

"You guys went from Cuban to Zydeco to Celtic to Uncle Tupelo, I had no idea what the hell you were going to pull out next!" This was overheard after DK's set at Treefort last year.  
This group of musicians is out to rouse the crowd with originals and interpretations of tunes that veer wildly through their sets-- made up of Garrett Finley on cajon and percussion, Micah Deffries on lead guitar, Tony Lemmon making the fiddle sing and Ryan Blizzard solid in the pocket on that big doghouse bass.  Steve Baker and Garr formed DK years ago in a moldy airstream trailer on the back 40, and since then have moved a little beyond their original goal of bluegrass Rush covers...thank goodness. Veterans of Live after five and Treefort and many a beautiful backyard wedding, Deviant Kin is down to play!

body.name: esme patterson (solo)
body.bio: With an electric guitar and an electric voice, blows past contradictions with a defiant confidence.

body.name: Selby Jenkins - Conflict of Interest
body.bio: Conflict of Interest is an experimental work that is altered depending on the environment that it is performed in. Throughout the festival, Selby Jenkins will appear in multiple venues, some scheduled, some not, to consistently put herself in non-traditional dance spaces. Contingent upon venue, tone of the crowd, and whatever other variables are thrown her way, the work will be heavily altered as to test the limits of her creative and improvisational ability.

body.name: U.S. Girls
body.bio: It's been 10 years of U.S. Girls as the unapologetic pop revisionist we know and love. What better way to celebrate than to witness creator Meg Remy, backed by a sample-emulating large ensemble, attempt to swing all fates toward love. The expatriate returns Stateside with a plan to dance beyond reality. Performing compositions that Pitchfork has called “part Shangri-Las, part Sun Ra” alongside new material from the soon-to-be-released follow-up to 2015’s celebrated, 4AD-backed, “Half Free”, may this live show give you the courage to face whatever the next 10 years may bring!

body.name: Willy Vlautin
body.bio:
Born and raised in Reno, Nevada, Vlautin started playing guitar and writing songs as a teenager and quickly became immersed in music. It was a Paul Kelly song, based on Raymond Carver’s Too Much Water So Close to Home that inspired him to start writing stories. Vlautin has published four novels: THE MOTEL LIFE (2007), NORTHLINE (2008), LEAN ON PETE (2010), and THE FREE (2014). His fifth, DON’T SKIP OUT ON ME, is due out in February 2018.

Vlautin founded the band Richmond Fontaine in 1994. The band produced eleven studio albums, plus a handful of live recordings and EPs. Driven by Vlautin’s dark, story-like songwriting, the band, now retired, achieved critical acclaim at home and across the UK and Europe.

In 2014 Vlautin formed The Delines with singer Amy Boone (The Damnations) and released their first album, Colfax. The band is on hiatus while Boone recovers from injuries sustained in a car accident.

Vlautin currently resides in Scappoose, Oregon.

body.name: Vundabar
body.bio: Vundabar is a Boston rock band who write rambunctious, garage and post-punk influenced tunes with ear-worm melodies. Their loose, open song structures allow for shifting paces and space to slide across the continuum from light indie to heavy rock. Lead singer Brandon Hagen's vocal delivery is scattered and unpredictable; he will yelp and scream as soon as he'll utter a soft falsetto or a chanting, conversational monotone. Though their lyrical content can get dreary, Vundabar retains a playful sense of sarcasm to leave the listener in an optimistic, cathartic state.

body.name: E&J aka Eleven & Jason D
body.bio:
E&J aka Eleven & Jason D aspire to carry forward the Hip Hop culture of the 90's boom bap Hip Hop they grew up on.  Both have deep California roots but have called the City of Trees their home for more than a decade.  Eleven handles the microphone mastery while Jason D is the man behind the beats and the wheels of steel.  

Their first self-titled album "Eleven & Jason D" was released to critical acclaim and recently listed in the Boise Record Exchange top ten albums of 2017.  It's available for free at https://elevenandjasond.bandcamp.com

Let us take you back to a time when original beats and lyrics mattered.  It's one MC and one DJ who rock the spot.  We're here to earn your respect.

body.name: Tyler Brewington
body.bio: Tyler Brewington is the author of the chapbook Dear Stray Volcano and, with Kelly Schirmann, the collection Boyfriend Mountain (Poor Claudia, 2015). His poems have appeared in PEN America’s PEN Poetry Series, Salt Hill, Powder Keg, Sixth Finch, and elsewhere. He is a contributing editor at Seattle-based Gramma Press and received an MFA from the Vermont College of Fine Arts. He lives in Boise, Idaho, and is @bylertrewington in all of the places.

body.name: Dodgy Mountain Men
body.bio:
Dodgy Mountain Men sling a home-brewed Montana stompgrass that goes down smooth but packs a bite, mixing the rhythms of bluegrass, the soul of the blues and the energy of rock 'n' roll with a plethora of other musical traditions to create a unique electro-acoustic experience. The group's genre-bending experimentation and passion for American roots traditions weave together to emphasize their lyrical storytelling, creating a musical frontier rife with empty mason jars, outlaws, gypsy women and cold Montana storms. Add three distinct frontmen, a pension for sonic exploration and live performances that build to a fever pitch,and you've got a concoction that will make moonshiners proud and compel dancers to wear out the soles of their shoes.

DMM released their sophomore album, Changing Lanes, in the fall of 2016 as a testament to the evolution of the group from a sideways folk outfit to a fully-recognized band pushing the borders of Americana. Boasting strong dynamics, bold songwriting and a rowdy live-energy feel, Changing Lanes is the work of a band who has heard the calling of the road and responded with song. Dodgy Mountain Men has toured from coast to coast, bringing their energetic sets to festivals including the John Hartford Memorial Festival (IN), Oak Harbor Festival (WA), Chinook Festival (WA),  Sawtooth Gathering (ID), Mystic Hot Springs Music Fest (UT), Love Your Mother Earth Festival (MT), Treefort Festival (ID), Red Ants Pants Festival and River City Roots (MT), to name a few. They have also had the pleasure of sharing more intimate stages with acts such as The Devil Makes Three, Greensky Bluegrass, The White Buffalo, Scott H. Biram, Jerry Joseph and the Jackmormons, Pert Near Sandstone, Toubab Krewe, Dead Winter Carpenters, Fruition, Brothers Comatose and countless others.

body.name: Red Feather Lounge
body.bio:
Chef Michael Ridder

Dishes:
-Saturday: Beef Belly Bao Buns with Desert Mountain Beef and Housemade Buns
-Sunday: Purple Viking Potato Chips from M&M Heath Farm

body.name: together PANGEA
body.bio: You don’t have to grow up all the way, do you? On their latest full-length album and first for NETTWERK, Bulls and Roosters, Together Pangea managed to hit a sweet spot between writing rock ‘n’ roll songs worthy of being hummed twenty years from now and maintaining the brash and ballsy bite fans know and love. The Los Angeles quartet—William Keegan [guitar, vocals], Danny Bengston [bass, vocals], Erik Jimenez [drums], and Roland Cosio [guitar]—essentially get louder by dialing the volume down.

body.name: Tylor & the Train Robbers
body.bio:
Tylor & The Train Robbers debut album "Gravel" is a perfect blend of gritty americana and outlaw honky tonk. This album has been described as honest, inviting and quintessentially western (Micheal Deeds - Idaho Statesman). Released in May of 2017, "Gravel" is a compilation of 10 original songs written by lead singer Tylor Ketchum. Tylor describes this album as a snapshot of the band just as you’d hear them at a live show. 

Currently, the Train Robbers are on the road touring throughout the US and are working on recording their second studio album, due out in the summer of 2018. 

....

Born and raised in Helix, Oregon, singer/songwriter Tylor Ketchum started playing music at an early age. Fueled by musical influences within his family, he formed The Bushman Brothers Band with his younger siblings and began performing at local venues and events. Determined to further his career, Tylor left home and headed to Idaho in search of a broader music scene. 

While establishing himself as a solo performer and becoming immersed in the Idaho music community, he decided to form the band that has evolved into Tylor and the Train Robbers. The name inspired by his late relative, the infamous, train-robbing, Black Jack Ketchum. 

Tylor carefully selected musicians he knew would help him achieve the sound he was looking for. He called on his younger brother, Jason Bushman to join him in Idaho and continue their musical journey together. With Jason playing bass and singing backup vocals they created a core molded around sibling harmony. Helping hold down the rhythm fort is their dynamic drummer, Flip Perkins. Rounding out the band’s sound is Johnny “Shoes” Pisano who brings his signature tele tone to the stage. 

With this strong line up in place, Tylor & the Train Robbers have created a unique blend of gritty americana and outlaw honky tonk that has struck a chord within Northwest music scene.

body.class_summary: Using the triple goddess archetype, the Hindu Tridevi, of Parvati, Saraswati, and Lakshmi, to deepen into our Psyche, with the use of myth, mantra, pranayama, and mudras. This provides us with tools to navigate the challenges of life. We learn to sit with the discomfort, change our perspective, come into conscious relationship with our bodies, the deeper aspects of our own Psyche, and others, leading to transformation and abundance. Ideally this would be a workshop format, to include journaling between each archetype, taking students on a journey of Self, to see their wholeness.
body.name: Cortney Taul and Harmony Forest
body.class_title: Embracing our Wholeness: The Totality of Now
body.bio:
Harmony and Cortney are both initiated priestesses, wellness professionals, and yoga teachers, passionate about guiding students to embrace their wholeness and worth, through finding the strengths and gifts in the shadow, or Psyche.They bonded over their passion to encourage students to connect deeply to Self, through breath and embodiment, discovering their innate wisdom.
Cortney is a RYT-200 yoga teacher, body movement specialist, coach, and wellness consultant who grew up in Idaho. She holds a Masters in Kinesiology, where her focus was in Sport and Exercise Psychology, and she has worked alongside physical therapists, physicians, mental health and health policy professionals. Cortney’s teachers include Shannon Wells Femenia, Ashley Turner, and Sianna Sherman, all of whom, helped her find her voice, weaving myth, magic, neuroscience, and psychology into her classes. She believes in the importance of mind-body-spirit connection and embracing our shadows, feeling the ultimate reward is helping individuals embrace their own unique gifts. 
Harmony is a RYT-500 yoga teacher, teaching for the past five years, as well as, an IIN, Institute for Integrated Nutrition, certified health coach, living in Scottsdale, Arizona, connecting with the magic and mystery of the mountains, nearby Sedona, pink skies, and enchanting moon rises. She has studied with John Salisbury, Ashley Turner, Saul David Raye, and Sianna Sherman. 
Currently, Cortney and Harmony are both working toward completion of the Yoga Psyche Soul advanced 300hr Yoga Teacher training, in yoga psychology, with Ashley Turner.

Workshop:
Sunday, 10-11 AM
Embracing our Wholeness: The Totality of Now
Music by CJ Boyd
Using the triple goddess archetype, the Hindu Tridevi, of Parvati, Saraswati, and Lakshmi, to deepen into our Psyche, with the use of myth, mantra, pranayama, and mudras. This provides us with tools to navigate the challenges of life. We learn to sit with the discomfort, change our perspective, come into conscious relationship with our bodies, the deeper aspects of our own Psyche, and others, leading to transformation and abundance. Ideally this would be a workshop format, to include journaling between each archetype, taking students on a journey of Self, to see their wholeness.

body.name: Robin Finck, Composer
body.bio:
Robin Finck is widely known as the guitar player of Nine Inch Nails, having performed the world over with the group since 1993 to date.  He is a prominent figure in the band’s lineup through 20+ years.

Robin began his work in game score by way of Devolver Digital, an Austin based video game publisher associated with the Serious Sam and Hotline Miami series, among others. Devolver Digital’s ambient horror game ‘NOCT’ was scored by Robin in collaboration with Pedro Pimentel. Robin continues to immerse himself in the gaming community. He was a presenter at the Develop Reboot Conference, Dubrovnik, 2017.

body.name: Dave the Fave
body.bio:
Dave Boutdy was born and raised in Boise, ID and received his Bachelor’s in Business Administration for Marketing from Boise State University. During his time in college, he assisted with marketing initiatives for Albertson’s Stadium and NASA. Dave hosted and helped promote a Space Symposium event, where he and his educational team held a public conference via Skype with Expedition 39 astronauts who were orbiting Earth at the time.  

For 14 years, Dave utilizes his spare time to involve himself in the entertainment industry, and his background in the field spans a wide spectrum. He always had an affinity for producing music and began creating his own in 2004. Since then, he has maintained a rap group "Dedicated Servers" with his best friend Matt, and they continue to perform in Boise and tour the west coast whenever they can. Dave is also a touring DJ and credits his experience to past wedding gigs as well as self-teaching. 

With a touring job which utilizes all of his entertainment expertise, Dave enjoys filling his leisure time with trail running and in the past two years, hosting a weekly video game stream through Twitch. He recently became a Twitch Affiliate due to his frequent stream schedule and amount of viewership. Video games are a big part of Dave's life (even apparent in his music), and he's happy to have his own community via live game streaming. 

Upon his success on Twitch, Dave quickly saw that even on this platform, communities thrive on networking and connections (literally). He is thrilled to be joining Hackfort 2018 for discussions specifically about Twitch streaming, but also to just meet all the forward-thinkers who will be attending as well as speaking at the event.

body.name: Juniper
body.bio:
Chef Aaron Wermerskirchen

Dish:
-Double Springs Ranch Beef Brisket Braised in Barbarian Scottish Ale with Zursun Black Lentils, Fried Laura Lee Farms Kale, Eden Creamery Feta and Whole Grain Mustard Jus.

body.name: Hummingbird Of Death
body.bio: Progressive, intense fastcore that calls on a number of extreme music traditions, from punk to death metal to prog rock. Since 2005 we have completed several tours on the western half of the continent, released a plentitude of EPs and split records, and we have just released our 3rd full-length album "Forbidden Techniques" on To Live A Lie Records.

body.name: The Hand
body.bio: Hard rock, punk, power trio.

body.name: Data! What is it good for?
body.bio: These days there’s nothing but data out there — social media statistics, Spotify artist insights, info about who your fans are, where they are, and when they listen to your music. But what do you do with all this data? And who is really benefitting from it? This panel will be recorded as a Future of What podcast episode where host Portia Sabin talks to experts in the industry about pressing issues facing musicians today.

body.name: ohbrando
body.bio: yung boi

body.name: Poetry and Mimosas
body.bio:
Two hours of Poetry, Mimosas, Bloody Marys, and a big helping of wisdom.

Featuring poetry from:

Cameron McGill
Alexandra Teague
Josh Booton
Ameerah Bader
Tyler Brewington
Alice Nelson

body.name: The Colossal Collective: Puppets, Pixels, and Programming
body.bio: When art meets technology, cool things tend to happen. Come meet the tech team behind the Colossal Collective's latest puppet, a magnificent peacock with over and 2500 individually addressed LED lights. You'll get a hands-on look at the project, and we'll discuss some of the advancements in hardware and software that are making large-scale art projects easier and cheaper than ever before.

body.name: Nude Oil
body.bio: Formed in Boise in 1996 for "No Good Reason" Nude Oil has been a mainstay in the local music scene for over the last ten years since their return to the City of Trees. Releasing two albums over the past 6 years, Nude Oil is intent on keeping a straight forward 90's punk/ska sound alive here in Idaho. Over the past couple of years Nude Oil has had the pleasure of opening for such notable punk acts as The Descendents, Guttermouth, The Interrupters, Three Bad Jacks, The Shell Corporation along with many other acts.  Catchy harmonies mixed with up-tempo beats is Nude Oil's recipe for a good time that will leave one singing along, even if they do not know the words.

body.class_summary: This is a unique fusion of full on get freaky dance party and heart-first intentional movement practice. Inspired by beats from dancehall and full spectrum EDM to old-school pop and hip-hop favorites, The Dance Commander will guide us in a dance experience where everyone feels like the BAD ASS they are.  Glittered sweat is flung and endless amounts of high-fives and smiles are shared. Everyone will leave feeling like their inner dance spirit animal is fully awake and ready to roar.  Expect to booty pop and fist-pump your way into the most blissed-out dance floor hangover you’ve never known.
body.name: Celeste Bolin
body.bio:
Celeste is an interesting mixture of part dance floor rabble-rouser, part whimsical yogini and somewhere in there is a scientist as well (her other life is as a biology teacher).  How do all these things come together?  She believes in the magic of the body, the power of personal expression, the journey that community festivals take us on that change us forever, and how legitimately we can mold our personal biologies with our transformational movement experiences.  She is Dr. Bolin, the Dance Commander and the experience of her method is best felt on a sweaty dance floor…

Workshop:
Friday, 3-4 PM
Music by Sol Rising
This is a unique fusion of full on get freaky dance party and heart-first intentional movement practice. Inspired by beats from dancehall and full spectrum EDM to old-school pop and hip-hop favorites, The Dance Commander will guide us in a dance experience where everyone feels like the BAD ASS they are. Glittered sweat is flung and endless amounts of high-fives and smiles are shared. Everyone will leave feeling like their inner dance spirit animal is fully awake and ready to roar. Expect to booty pop and fist-pump your way into the most blissed-out dance floor hangover you’ve never known.

body.name: Pujol
body.bio:
Daniel Pujol is an artist based out of Nashville, TN. He moved to Nashville in 2007 to co-found his first band, MEEMAW. Now, Music City serves as the home-base for his eponymous musical project, Pujol. 

His song catalog includes numerous singles, EPs and LPs on labels such as Third Man Records, Infinity Cat Recordings, and Saddle Creek Records. In addition to music, Daniel writes prose and poetry. He has been published by The Nashville Cream, Third Man Books, Sobotka Literary Magazine, Impose Magazine, The Walrus, Ursus Americanus, Cosmic Thug, The Contributor, etc. Daniel currently writes an ongoing fiction serial titled The One Off. 

The latest Pujol releases are Political Errors @TheEndOfThe20thCentury (2017 short-story LP), Mighty Stranger (2016 chapbook), and blend of writing and music called KISSES (late 2015). Daniel is now finishing a new Pujol LP, produced by Drew Vandenberg.

Email Daniel Pujol here: danielluccapujol@gmail.com

body.name: Aan
body.bio:
After 10 years, two LP's, a mess of singles and EP's, about 15 different guitar players, drummers and bass players, Bud Wilson's starting to figure out how this whole thing works. Called everything from Freak-Folk to Prog-Pop, there's no way of knowing what an Aan set is going to sound like, but it's definitely going to be sprawling and playful.
Aan takes a lot of sonic chances, employing out-jazz chord structures, soaring falsetto and throbbing low end. It's like Yes and Why? and The Who all together. Whoa, is that even ok?
Aan's last LP "Dada Distractions" was a heady chug of desperation and mourning. Finding influence equally in Aphrodite's Child and Alice in Chains. Their new tunes slated for LP3 find the band in a much more bubbling soup of sound, with tracks vibing to an Odelay dirt pulse. This will be their most expansive release to date so catching them while their still putting the finishing touches on these new cuts could prove exciting, either watching them flail or seeing them take flight.

body.name: Mike Wilson, Devolver Digital
body.bio:
Mike Wilson has been a leading executive in the 130 billion dollar global video games industry since 1994, and has dedicated his career to making this new and exciting global industry a better place to work for the bright young talents behind all of these incredible feats of art and engineering, which are being created at a rate that already dwarfs any entertainment or tech industry that came before it.   

He has worked as a producer and mentor with myriad independent developers and studios all over the world on more than 100 commercially released titles, and has helped guide many of them to financial independence without compromising their vision or artistic integrity.  He took his start as "the guy who marketed DOOM and Quake" for id Software to found four different publishing companies, two of which have been acquired by public companies and two that are still independent and very active (Devolver Digital and Good Shepherd Entertainment).  

His current vision that he is speaking to us about is his most ambitious project to date; to marry these two worlds, and to help create a completely new and unique model of schooling and community for these artists and engineers to live, learn, teach, and thrive in.  He believes that this diverse population of creative and technical geniuses, who all too often live and work in isolation, can be brought together to help solve many of the largest problems facing the world, starting with this creation of a living blueprint for the establishment of new, sustainable peer-teaching communities outside of urban environments, that will also serve as a showcase of various renewable energy technologies, as well as a unique international tourist destination.

body.name: Zee's Rooftop
body.bio:
Chef Chris Zahn

Dishes:
Saturday: Beef French Dip
Sunday: Smoked Idaho Barley Risotto from Kaufman Farms with Ballard Farms Cheese.

Bio:
Born and raised in Butte, Montana, Chris Zahn arrived in Boise in 2004 to work at the Arid Club, a members-only dining and social organization. A year later, he concurrently pursued a degree in the culinary arts at Boise State University. Zahn said the BSU program granted credits for volunteering and once he did that a few times, he “got the [volunteer] bug.” Chef Zahn was awarded the American Culinary Federation Chef of the Year award for Southern Idaho in 2015. 

1.) What is your favorite Idaho Ingredient? 
Beef then trout

2.) What is your favorite Idaho Beverage?
Idaho beers by Payette and Boise Brewing

3.) What is your favorite spice?
Lemon verbena 

What Treefort experience are you looking forward to most?
Meeting all of Boise's foodies.

body.name: Serpentfoot
body.bio:
Serpentfoot is a three-piece psychedelic garage rock band from Fort Collins, CO. Formed in early 2015 by Jordan Twiggs and Michael Ross in an effort to revive some of the music that had been scrapped by an earlier music project. They quickly brought in Philip Shellabarger to fill out the three piece that exists today. While the initial influences included Ty Segall, Thee Oh Sees, Bass Drum of Death, and other similar jangly garage and surf rock, the band has grown to incorporate heavier psychedelic aspects.

"Like all of the great rock and roll trios in history, Serpentfoot manage to create tunes that seem so much bigger and grander than what you would think just three people are capable of. Marrying heavy and probably drug induced aural kilos of psych-rock a la the Brian Jonestown Massacre and the artsy proto-punk sneer of bands like Television and the Sonics is already a recipe for beautiful disaster. Easily. But the ‘foot doesn’t stop there; they then decide to add heapin’ helpin’s of noodly 60’s era surf and garage rock into the cake they’re baking, turning the whole mess of a into a new album and band that is so damn good you’ll need the recipe." - Pulp Magazine

body.name: Sautrah

song.title: X&G - Nowhere (Black Plague Remix) [Black Plague is Sautrah x Mamm0th]

body.bio:
Growing up in the hardcore/metal scene in Boise, ID and Spokane, WA; Sautrah has set herself apart from other artists with her eclectic and unique taste in song selection. DJing for seven years and living in places across the world, she has been a resident DJ at CrowBar and Fatty’s Bar, and played almost every bar and club in town including Konnexion Music Festival, Sensory Illumination, Treefort Music Fest, and has brought headlining acts out to play with her at her own monthly, Black Bass. She is also ½ of the local DJ/Producer duo Black Plague.

Some of her music’s biggest influences come from the art in Japan, UK Garage and Night Bass, Dirtybird Records, American and European Dubstep and Trap, old school Jazz and Big Band, African tribal music, vocalist Corey Taylor and his band Slipknot, poets Lana Del Rey and Shakespeare, Shambhala Music Festival, her friends X&G, and some good old fashioned occult magick. 

She studies music and poetry at Boise State University, and plays the instruments ukulele, piano, and is picking up bass guitar this year. She is currently in the studio writing music, singing and producing EDM, and compiling her own poetry book. Supporting local artists and the music scene continues to be one of her greatest purposes and joys.

She would like to leave you with two of her favorite quotes regarding her purpose in music:

“Let us read, and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.” - Voltaire

“We’re shamanic healers offering glimpses of enlightenment through music.” – Calvin Harris, What Would Diplo Do

Sautrah is very excited to play Treefort again and honored to play music for you.

body.name: Board Game Detox Brunch
body.bio: We know you'll be on crazy overload from a full week of fun, so we are hosting our Board Game Detox Brunch to ease you into the last day of Treefort. Headed up by the dudes over at Gem State Gaming, they'll provide board games that you are able to learn in your Sunday-morning haze over omelets and bloody mary's.

body.name: Ballet Folklorico - Mexico Lindo!
body.bio: Ballet Folklorico Mexico Lindo Idaho! is a community-based dance group from the Treasure Valley. Established in 2003, The 40+member group is dedicated to teaching and sharing the heritage-rich tradition of Mexican folk dance. Reflecting a colorful, vibrant culture, the dances portray the life events, emotions and history of the beautiful regions in Mexico.

body.name: Danger Bomb

song.title: Danger Bomb - We Can't Feel It Still

body.bio:
Two Mashup forces collide when Danger Bomb preforms. The first half is DJ Winkle who has enjoyed great success with his mashup group "Gigglebomb". A live drummer and multiple song DJ experience has been lighting up dance floors in the Boise, Idaho area for over 4 years.

The second half of Danger Bomb is Grave Danger. He is a world renown mashup producer from Richmond, Virginia. He has been featured on numerous websites with perfectly crafted mashups that are very danceable, different sounding yet unmistakably familiar with his hooks and samples.

Together these mashup powerhouses will join to deliver a performance that will delight the ears and eyes. Video projections, live drumming and musical surprises will electrify your soul and blow your mind. Its a safe to say that Danger Bomb will be a experience you won't soon forget.

body.name: Jared Hallock
body.bio: ...an exploration of frequency and dissonance via the vibraphone.

body.name: Cliff Cash
body.bio:
Cliff Cash is the funniest guy you haven't heard of (yet). His style of comedy truly embodies the "new south".  
A south yearning to be seen as more than camouflage  and racism, a generation of young Americans bucking the often archaic values and dogma they were raised on. His brand of humor fearlessly tackles subjects of racism, homophobia, greed, war, loss, death, divorce and the danger of ignorance in pop culture and music. One moment he's using a satirical uber conservative redneck character to illuminate the fallacies of the far right talking points. The next moment he cleverly dissects some of today's most absurd rap lyrics. Cash remains dynamic and unique from the time he steps on stage until he says goodnight. When he's not on stage, Cliff spends most of his time in nature. He's on a mission to see #everynationalpark and put a million miles on his Mercedes wagon that he essentially lives in #miIlionmilemercedes. In 6 short years Cash has racked up an impressive list of credits for a comic not living in a major market.

body.name: OPERATE MACHINERY UNDER THE INFLUENCE: Adult-friendly Hardware Hack
body.bio: Tristan Andreas is back for yet another Hardware Hack. This year, in addition to the family-friendly build, he will be hosting a beer-fueled grown-up build session at Hackfort Happy Hour featuring free beer and DIV instruments.

body.class_summary: We have all felt those moments of bliss and transcendence, where the world seems to stop, and all our existential weight disappears so we can feel content and present. We call that shift in consciousness lifes "secret sauce". Lets see if we can get lost in the sauce together, by creating a delicious blend of mind, body, soul union.  This class will be set to a slow simmer, on a yummy vinyasa setting, paired with a heaping portion of good vibes.
body.name: Kate Swarm
body.bio:
Kate Swarm is an international yoga teacher based out of Oregon, with a passion for creating unique and fully immersive experiences. She has a gift for holding a sacred space of transcendence, while guiding her students to a place of union between mind, body and soul. 

Over the last 5 years her devotion and excitement to exploring how environment, sensory input, and intention effects a shift in consciousness, has lead her to work beside some of the most gifted artists, musicians and creatives in the wellness movement; including Walter Yoga, for whom she is both a resident yoga instructor and event producer. Kate has taught at numerous yoga and music festivals throughout the Nation, blurring the lines between yoga, movement, meditation, visual engineering, and sound immersion.

When it comes to exploring her students internal environment, Kate is even more detail oriented. She has a warm, peaceful, and grounding presence that gently guides her students to a peak state of integrated body awareness, intelligent and thoughtful movement, and self realization. 
Besides holding a sacred space of mind-blowing-multidimensional-blissed-out-radical-transformation, Kate is a mom and a wife, who loves to dance and laugh, and never takes life too seriously. She started on her yoga journey after suffering through a sever hardship. Yoga was what helped Kate find love, peace, contentment and purpose for her life, it is her life's work to give that gift back to the world.

Workshop Descriptions: 
Friday, 1:45-2:45PM
VinSaucin'
Music by James Calleo
We have all felt those moments of bliss and transcendence, where the world seems to stop, and all our existential weight disappears so we can feel content and present. We call that shift in consciousness lifes "secret sauce". Lets see if we can get lost in the sauce together, by creating a delicious blend of mind, body, soul union. This class will be set to a slow simmer, on a yummy vinyasa setting, paired with a heaping portion of good vibes. 

Saturday, 10-11AM 
Balance and Harmony 
Music by Christopher Willits
Join Kate Swarm and Gordon Ogden, two dynamic teachers who will explore how opposite forces complete each other to create balance and harmony. They will use partner work and fun group asana to journey through the forces of yin and yang. This is an all levels class that Kate and Gordon have toured the nation teaching at music and yoga festivals. This class is fun alone, or with all your friends, so bring your tribe, or join a new one.

body.name: The Astrophobes
body.bio: We are a four-piece Powerpunk Band , and we have a blast doing it.

body.name: Amy Burton
body.bio: Amy Burton was born in Anchorage, Alaska and has bounced around Boise and the Pacific Northwest since 1987. She has a BFA in theatre from the University of Idaho and is currently pursuing an associates in creative writing from College of Western Idaho. She loves to read, write, bake, and sew, and enjoys spending time with her partner Noble and their dog Chimichanga.

body.name: Darlings
body.bio:
A new dance film by LED

Principal Cast | Brett Perry and Evan Stevens

body.name: Methods of Dance
body.bio:
From the MOD bio circa 1989:

With their third release A Million Miles of Green the Boise, Idaho based progressive, social dance quartet Methods of Dance has started on a journey to reach the world. Along with the music of the self-titled first release and the second release Justice, MOD is ready to make you sweat!!

(Our actual journey to reach the world got about as far as Portland)

Since their formation in the spring of 1984 members Todd Dunnigan (keyboards), Thomas J. Keithly the II (guitar), Corey Stoutenburg (bass) and Pete Weaver (drums) have worked hard fine tuning their talents. 'The music is a group effort,' Tom says 'A lot of our lyrics in our originals relate to day-to-day situations.'

(virtually none of our lyrics dealt with day-to-day situations)

'The important thing is not to be just another human jukebox,' Todd said 'You've got to do something original if you want to make it last.'

(In some strange twist of fate I have made a living for the past 18 years being a human jukebox)

Cynthia J. Kludt of Seattle's Rocket feels that 'without the emphasis on electronics the music is allowed to dominate. Such differences in musical content accentuate the band's versatility. The sound is now - hip music for hip times.'

(Unfortuantely this came right before grunge took over the world by purposely playing unhip music)

Todd and Pete have composed and performed music for television commercials, summer stock theater productions and the Idaho Shakespeare Festival, while Corey's exstensive musical experience includes playing trumpet with an Alaskan opera company. Tom, who fronts the band, has held a prominent position in a number of local bands. With the recent addition of Douglas P. Carnie (sound, lights, promo) the band is ready to branch out from it's Boise roots.

(All the way to Portland)

"We have a unique sound, not too heavily musical or philisophical" Corey says, "It's fun music...it's a nice blend"

(probably could have gone with that quote and called it good)

body.name: MeeRa (featuring Robin Finck)
body.bio: MeeRa is an experimental electronic music duo comprised of Robin Finck and Arkia Jahani.

body.name: Butcher Brown
body.bio: Butcher Brown is an up-to-the minute throwback to the great progressive jazz bands of the 60s and 70s. They are a hard-working band in an era where most groups are fleeting assemblages, together only long enough to record.  Their organic coherence emerges from long collaboration as a group of equals rather than a top-down, leader/sideman lineup. They are building their audience by any means necessary, combining a conventional, label-oriented approach with releasing “underground” tapes, disciplined rehearsal and engaging, adventurous performance. This musical maturity is surprising in such a youthful band. The players in Butcher Brown were all born after the mid-70s golden age of fusion. But their modern, hip-hop-inflected funk has rich echoes of Weather Report, Return to Forever, early Earth Wind and Fire and, perhaps, a pungent whiff of Zappa. Like those bands, Butcher Brown’s unified sound comes from the intertwined talents of the four members, each bringing something unique to the mix.

body.name: SURFS DRUGS
body.bio: In the zone, full of tone and stoned to the bone.

body.name: Everything Beautiful Is Far Away
body.bio:
Narrative Feature

A guy, his robot head companion, and a determined young woman trek a barren desert landscape in search of a mythic lake. EBIFA is a charming and confident film with characters tackling loneliness in a strange empty world.

Principal Cast | Joseph Cross, Julia Garner, C.S. Lee, and Jillian Mayer

body.name: Sea's Apprentice
body.bio: Non-fiction songs based in the dream reality with special attention to the frequencies which bring about comfort in the madness, Sea's Apprentice is modeling it's experience after that of the Ocean from which sanctuary can be found in closed eyes.

body.name: DADWAVE
body.bio:
DADWAVE is a project from Boise, Idaho’s Jeff Bull Jr. Born from his longing to create music that reflects a more accurate vision of himself, Bull accidentally spawned DADWAVE’s dirty rock n’ roll into the world in 2016. After gathering the group of musicians around him necessary to take these songs out of his bedroom into the real world, Bull stepped on the gas with DADWAVE in 2017 and hasn’t looked back. 

Not wanting to confine himself to one specific sound, Bull pulls equally from a vast array of ideas and influences for DADWAVE—his only concern being personal expression. “I just want these songs to be whatever I want to make without putting any restrictions on it,” says Bull. The result is a collection of songs as straightforward, carefree, and fun in one moment as unexpected and precise the next, all while retaining the cohesion of Bull’s singular musical vision from its origins as a bedroom recording project.

body.name: Open Arms Dance Project
body.bio: Open Arms Dance Project is a multigenerational and inclusive modern dance company; welcoming people of all ages -- with and without disabilities. Open Arms dancers range in age from 7-70+ years young.  Some dancers have physical and/or intellectual disabilities, and others do not.  All are respected for what they add to the group, whether that be youthful energy, humor, wisdom, dance skills, or a positive attitude.

body.name: Benyaro
body.bio:
Benyaro -- the indie roots project of seclusive Jackson Hole, WY musician who's worked with such artists as Gary Clark Jr., Brett Dennen and Shovels & Rope  -- recently announced the release of his third original full-length album, One Step Ahead of Your Past (September 8, Mohinga Music).
 
Produced with Danny Kadar (The Avett Brothers, My Morning Jacket) and recorded at the legendary Echo Mountain Recording and Ben Musser’s home studio in Wyoming, "One Step Ahead of Your Past" is “a deeply personal collection of tunes from a period in which I became a husband and a father," with songs that explore the profound, vibrant, and mundane with humility and humor.

Multi-instrumentalist Musser composed the thirteen "punk-Americana" (No Depression) tracks that comprise the record. For the first time, his longtime tour mate, upright bassist Leif Routman, joins on the recording. Additional guest musicians include Jacob Rodriguez (Michael Bublé) on tenor and baritone saxophone, and NYC’s Brian Geltner (Johnny Society) on drums.

body.class_summary: Here we dive deep into our center with attention to what supports us body, mind and spirit. Through a practice of power meridian strengthening, playful balance flow and  core value awareness, we ignite our inner axis and emerge to stand strong, centered and authentic.
body.name: Debbi Murphy
body.bio:
Exploring the mind-body connection is Debbi’s life work. After years in academia researching and teaching subjects that elevated one or the other half of that equation (doctorate in exercise science, master’s degree in counseling psychology), she turned her attention to the study of yoga – a perfect nexus of both.

Debbi studied with yoga masters to deepen her knowledge and hone her practice. Her alignment based, slow flow style evolved from early work with Rodney Yee, Richard Freeman and Shiva Rea. But the heart of her teaching comes from Erich Schiffmann, whose message of self-trust and the transformative power of yoga really resonated with her background.

Through more than 40 years of study and experience, including a decade as director of Shanti Yoga Teacher Training, Debbi found that the best approach to mind-body vitality is informed by both western science and the spirit of eastern yogic philosophy. Whether you’re attending her popular local classes, national conferences, or international retreats you can expect an artful blend of sound science, ancient wisdom, and mind-body-spirit integration woven together in the beautiful, juicy flow of the vinyasa tradition.

Workshop:
Friday, 10:45-11:45AM
Journey to the Center
Music By Dave Stringer, Sheela Bringi, Brent Kuecker, and Qais Essar
Here we dive deep into our center with attention to what supports us body, mind and spirit. Through a practice of power meridian strengthening, playful balance flow and core value awareness, we ignite our inner axis and emerge to stand strong, centered and authentic.

body.name: Space Car
body.bio:
SPACE. The foam in my beer... 
Somewhere in that black, murky, muddle of we-don't-know; Drives upon the roads of the universe, a captain,  a general, a barbarian, and a prince. Their car? Armed to the teeth with bouncy riffs, crunchy chords, and pseudo-tongue-in-cheek lyrics. There is no denying their 'superior firepower'.

In their adventures, the crew battles the wide spectrum of adversaries both internal and external in the black unknown. With the universe closing in, they have no choice but to swear allegiance to each other and bring sound to the emptiness.

Space Car has entertained crowds through the pacific northwest and has opened for Bad Cop Bad Cop and The Interupters. Taught with high energy, bouncy and crunchy riffs, and smiles for days. Everyone enjoys a Space Car show.

body.name: Helvetia
body.bio:
Helvetia is a project that morphed out of the remains of the late 90’s band Duster. Jason Albertini and Dove Amber started performing the songs Jason was recording after moving to Seattle WA from San Jose Ca. This culminated with the first album “ The Clever North Wind “ being released by Duster braintrust, Clay Parton’s Static Cult Label along with Up records helping out with most aspects of an official release. They toured with Built To Spill and 10 Helvetia Albums in 10 years later Jason improbably joined BTS as the new bass player guy. He at that time hooked up helvetia with Joyful Noise Recordings and has released Nothing in Rambling (2012) and Dromomania (2015)  and am e.p ( Sun Chaser, 2017) with these lovely Indiana folks. 

The name Helvetia was a nod at Jasons Swiss roots, having grown up next to Basel until heading for CA when he was 12. (With his mom and sister, not by himself.) every 1,2 and 5 frank coin bears the image of Helvetia, the female embodiment of the Swiss) It’s free associative, cut and paste, odd pop music that has been recorded all mostly by J. He has had lots of help along the way. 

The band currently is Sam Stidham on bass, Katherine Paul ( Black Belt Eagle Scout ) on drums. Zeke Howard will be playing drums from time to time as his schedule permits, for the double drum bonanza that recreates a lot of the early recordings that where recorded with Jason and dove both playing the same beat into a 4 track ( old new bicycle, everything on the headless machine of the heart album). Jim Roth, long time friend and musical companion plays guitar along with Jason. Jason, Sam and Katherine sing. Anyways, 15 years after helvetia began, Jason is working on the final album called “28 songs and 3$ Tears” being released sometime late 2018. It will be their best record so far, no doubt. And we will keep playing shows because it’s fun. But if there are any other records it will be called HellAwaitsYa. Because Helvetia is a crappy band name, turns out. Xoxoxo

body.class_summary: Dr. Sapiro will guide students in an expanding Yoga Nidra practice, exploring images and visions of one's deepest potential.  He will then offer a short Dharma talk on the subject of fulfilling the vow of one's birth, what gets in the way, and how to move toward one's highest potential.
body.name: Dr. Michael Sapiro
body.class_title: Expanding Human Potential with Yoga Nidra
body.bio:
Michael Sapiro, PsyD, ERYT-500, is a clinical psychologist, meditation teacher, and a former Buddhist monk.  He is core faculty in the Sage Yoga and Wellness Yoga Teacher Training program in Boise, Idaho and is on faculty at Esalen Institute. Dr. Sapiro is a Fellow at the Institute of Noetic Sciences where he collaborates on studies researching consciousness and transformational practices. Dr. Sapiro is the founding director of Maitri House Yoga, LLC, which promotes the health and well being for individuals and the community by integrating clinical psychology, Buddhist dharma, nondual meditation and philosophy, noetic sciences, and social justice.  He presents nationally on noetic approaches to health and well being, and can be found at maitrihouseyoga.com.

Workshop:
Sunday, 2-3 PM
Expanding Human Potential with Yoga Nidra
Music by Chrystalina
Dr. Sapiro will guide students in an expanding Yoga Nidra practice, exploring images and visions of one's deepest potential. He will then offer a short Dharma talk on the subject of fulfilling the vow of one's birth, what gets in the way, and how to move toward one's highest potential.

body.name: Deeveaux
body.bio: Deeveaux spawned from circuitry within the motherboards of a thousand cyborgs.

body.name: Myke Bogan
body.bio:
Myke Bogan, who floats between Portland and LA, has enjoyed remarkable underground and commercial buzz by consistently releasing good music. Past mixtape hit number 14 on iTunes Top 100, and another hit number one on Bandcamp the day it dropped. He’s attracting the right kind of attention and has successfully set the precedent for his stylized visuals and dynamic delivery. All of his accomplishments coupled with a charismatic and fiery persona, have resulted in a cult like following for Bogan.

“Pool Party”  his most recent release was nominated third for best album of the year by Willamette Weekly. He also received other positive reviews by Pitchfork, Earmilk, Paste, Vortex Mag, Eyes and Edge, Hip Hop DX, Pigeons and Planes and more.

body.name: SassyBlack
body.bio:
SassyBlack is a space aged vocalist & producer based in Seattle, WA. You may know her voice from her previous group THEESatisfaction or her work on the Shabazz Palaces albums. This Goddess of “electronic psychedelic soul” & “hologram funk” explores sound through deep compositions. With roots in classical & jazz, her voice is comparable to Ella Fitzgerald & Sarah Vaughan while her production value is reminiscent of Roy Ayers, Pharrell & Herbie Hancock. Black has traveled the world having performed in Berlin, Barcelona, New Orleans, Milan, London, Brooklyn & more.

Sassy has gained praise from The Fader, NYLON, Pitchfork, Noisey, Saint Heron, SPIN & many others. She successfully released her sophomore album New Black Swing June 23rd and is currently touring North America & Europe in Autumn 2017.

body.name: The Hoot Hoots
body.bio:
Seattle power pop quartet The Hoot Hoots are irresistible party starters. Their songs are powered by fuzzy guitars, fuzzier keyboards, and headhum-inducing hooks, and all these combine in a glorious, slightly insane energy in both their live shows and in their latest album, Colorpunch.

Seattle Weekly has compared them favorably to the Shins, the Deli Seattle Magazine has praised them for their "flashy, out-of-control pop sensibilities," and Seattle radio 90.3 KEXP named their song “Go For a Walk” their Song of the Day, calling it a “brilliant pop tune and nothing you should skip out on”. Think vintage Flaming Lips with a splash of NES and a dash of the Unicorns, and you get the idea.

body.name: Hugh Acheson
body.bio:
Dish:
Hugh’s Pho with basil, shaved Vidalia onion, radish, carrot, seared SRF deckle steak, rice noodles and bean sprouts.

Bio:
HUGH ACHESON is a chef and author who lives in Athens, GA. He is the chef/owner/partner of the Athens, Georgia, restaurants 5&10 and The National, the Atlanta restaurants Empire State South, Achie’s, and coffee shop Spiller Park Coffee. His latest cookbook, The Chef & The Slow Cooker, which was published in 2017, brings a chef's mind to the slow cooker, with recipes showing readers how an appliance often relegated to convenience cooking can open up many culinary doors.

1.) What is your favorite Idaho Ingredient?​ 
The potato, naturally. But seriously. 

2.) What is your favorite Idaho Beverage?​ 
I had some really good cider from Meriwether Cider last year. I'm looking forward to tasting that again. 

3.) What is your favorite spice?​
Tellicherry peppercorn. 

4.) What Treefort experience are you looking forward to most?​
George Clinton & Parliament Funkadelic.

body.name: Wild Ones
body.bio:
Wild Ones delve into the bliss and burden that musicians are tasked with today: create work that captures your spirit, but do it without selling your soul. Self-produced and recorded, they walk the line of DIY oddity and polished pop sheen. Hailing from Portland, Oregon, the band combines the talents of lead vocalist Danielle Sullivan, keyboardist Thomas Himes, drummer Seve Sheldon, guitarist Nick Vicario and bassist Max Stein. Growing up on Cocteau Twins and En Vogue, their sound is a mash of R&B synths, muted guitar, and somber vocal melodies. After 7 years together, they've hit their stride in creating work that poses questions about art and authenticity.

Mirror Touch, the band’s latest record releasing in October 2017 via Topshelf Records, explores spaces of isolation, loneliness and how it feels when the line between self and other becomes blurred. The record title refers to the condition "Mirror Touch Synesthesia" and the physiological experience of empathy. How can you know yourself, when in public you become everyone else? The songs explore the quest to maintain artistic self-integrity in an industry that seeks to homogenize. Solitary in their process of collaboration, Himes and Vicario produce the music, while Sullivan crafts lyrics and melodies, their attempt at self-preservation against the ever-changing expectations of what music should or should not be. Combining their style of upbeat melodies with a backdrop of darker lyrical themes, an inquiry into their artistic process ultimately reflects a balance between earnest head nods to their favorite sounds with a fierce loyalty to their own sense of self.

body.name: Thick Business
body.bio: You know that reoccurring dream you have where it's a rainy night so you go out to your favourite disco to warm up and chill out and all of a sudden David Gilmour walks up and asks if he can dance with you but just keeps trying to yell over the music about all his past relationships and its getting really heavy but then he apologizes and smokes you out and the night ends with everything turning into crystals and elves and sh*t? Thick Business was the band playing your dream disco that night.

body.name: Treepeople
body.bio: Treepeople was a punk band from Boise, Idaho, although it spent most of its time and was officially based in Seattle, Washington. The band was formed in 1988 by Scott Schmaljohn (Stuntman, The Treatment, The Hand), Pat ‘Brown’ Schmaljohn (Hive), Wayne Rhino Flower (Violent Green, The Halo Benders, Faintly Macabre’), and Doug Martsch (Built to Spill, Halo Benders). Treepeople went through a few incarnations and finally disbanded in 1994, having released five albums and a handful of singles. These reunion shows will feature all living original members and Troy Wright (Ipper, Troyject, Hand of Doom, Sandusky Furs, Magnetics, Psychic Knot, Dunce Cap, USA {United States of Apathy}) on bass, replacing Pat who passed away in 1999.

body.name: Porlolo
body.bio:
Porlolo is the musical project of Erin Roberts, formed in 2002 with guitarist Tom Mohr. Current lineup includes Ben DeSoto on drums and Anna Morsett on bass. Melancholic melodies, folk pop hits, and creep rock.

Porlolo discography includes What Would This Be For (Split EP with Roger Green, 2002), Storm and Season (2004), Meadows (2006), Pony Trekk (Split EP with Kate Magnus, 2009) and Everything, Barely (2014). Porlolo's new EP Awards is due out February 2018 and was recorded and produced by James Barone (Beach House).

Tunes are available on iTunes, Amazon, CD Baby, and at shows.

Porlolo has extensively toured the US, playing alongside Cass McCombs, Destroyer, Magnolia Electric Company, Fleet Foxes, Phosphorescent, Two Gallants and more.

body.name: Hear The Taste
body.bio: After attending his Grandpa's funeral, Hunter Zach (Hear The Taste) felt disillusioned with the things in his life that he had previously felt were important.  From that point forward, he dedicated 4 months to writing and recording a solo album that he felt encapsulated his feelings of madness.  The music is a blend of groove, indie, electronic, and classic rock.  You might like it.  You might not.

body.name: Lidia Yuknavitch
body.bio: Lidia Yuknavitch is the author of National Bestselling novels The Book of Joan and The Small Backs of Children, winner of the 2016 Oregon Book Award’s Ken Kesey Award for Fiction as well as the Reader’s Choice Award, the novel Dora: A Headcase, and a critical book on war and narrative, Allegories Of Violence (Routledge). Her widely acclaimed memoir The Chronology of Water was a finalist for a PEN Center USA award for creative nonfiction and winner of a PNBA Award and the Oregon Book Award Reader’s Choice. A book based on her recent TED Talk, The Misfit’s Manifesto, was released in October 2017.

body.name: REFLEKTION
body.bio: All-embracing grooves for the restless.

body.name: Afrosonics
body.bio:
Since music is the universal language, it’s only fitting that AFROSONICS has chosen this medium to bring people with diverse musical influences together in the creation of an original music style. Audiences experience new vibes through a fusion of guitars, drums, percussion, keyboards, electronic soundscapes, vocals, dance and chants. Although most of the rhythms are of African and American origin, it’s tough to put a label on their sound.

Afrosonics incorporates music from all over the world and the root of each member intermingles to create something both classic and unique. In addition to their own music, the group draws an influence from other musical genres i.e. South American, The Caribbean, Funk, Southern American Jazz, Blues, Rock and others that capture the true essence of the African, American or Universal spirit.

body.name: Laika The Dog
body.bio: Laika the Dog is an outerspace-obsessed, mathy, emo, pop-punk project conceived by Albuquerque-to-Boise transplant, guitarist/vocalist Will Hall in the winter of 2014-15. What started as a solo recording bedroom band (with Will playing all instruments and singing) eventually morphed into a full crew with the addition of drummer Justin Arroues, bassist Jake Lutz, and guitarist/vocalist Patrick Misner in the spring of 2016. Fixated on interstellar travel, their lyrics tend to use this motif to explore the perils of human relationships, but they also delve into more down-to-earth subjects. Like butts. The band recorded a 9-song album in the late summer of 2017 and are working to release it in the near future. In their last year of performing they’ve shared local stages with such acts as Amigo the Devil, Peelander-Z, Strawberry Girls, and The Fall of Troy.

body.name: Laura Diaz
body.bio: Laura Diaz is a recent Boise State University graduate where she received a B.A. in Social Sciences. She is also a gun violence survivor. The daughter of Amparo Godinez, Laura pursues social change to help break ground in Idaho on desperately needed legislation to help further protect and save lives of battered women and children. Laura's passion stems from an unfortunate and tragic experience in her life where she lost her mother to gun violence at the hands of her father. She seeks to uplift silenced voices by using her own to shine light on issues like domestic violence, gun violence and the intersecting adversities that come from these social issues. Her motivation and insight is seen and heard wherever she goes, and she hopes to begin a legacy in the name of her mother and other women who have been victims of these forms of violence. Laura aspires to become an attorney that challenges the current systems put in place that are supposed to protect and serve and she hopes to one day be able to create the change the state of Idaho needs to see.

body.name: Mother Yeti
body.bio: Mother Yeti is an eclectic rock band that hails from the Northwest. The band began as a jam session between two high school friends from Boise Idaho, and has evolved to become a blend of organized chaos.  Inspired by classic rock, soul, and Americana, while also influenced by low-fi drum machines, noisy guitar riffs, and psychedelic experiences.  Mother Yeti isn’t afraid to stray from the path, and has been consistently attempting to bend genres to their ears’ content.

body.name: Elena Gallina
body.bio: Elena grew up the child of humanitarian aid workers in the aftermath of the Balkan wars. In the years since, as a student, volunteer, and activist she's assisted in a variety of social empowerment capacities in Jordan, Swaziland, Cambodia, Kosovo, Israel, and Palestine. Her work with refugee women has ranged from project development in camps in Jordan to research in Palestine to her current role of job trainer and interpreter in Boise. In her final semester at BSU, her studies have blended economics, political science, and gender in an effort to examine how international agencies can better serve women and girls in the midst of disaster.  Throughout her work and travels she's used photography and journalism as a means of both educating others and coping with the violent absurdity of the world around her. One of her greatest passions is using her work to emphasize the shared human  experience found across cultures, contexts, and communities.

body.name: deathlist
body.bio: Deathlist is a goth-punk trio from Portland, Oregon featuring Jenny Logan from Summer Cannibals, Maggie Morris of Genders and Sunbathe, and Pieter Hilton from Typhoon. Their music is a mix of "frenzied punk rock [songs] that riff wildly until they're caught in a buzzy entanglement of guitar-driven chaos."  Their debut s/t album was released on XRAY Records in 2017, and their second full-length will be out in March, 2018.

body.name: CMMNWLTH
body.bio: CMMNWLTH started in the Spring of 2017 when Joe Calvi moved to Boise, ID, and recorded the six-song Commonwealth EP as a DIY solo-project, which was completely crowd-funded. Shortly after the release of the Kickstarter-backed EP, Joe's cousin Patrick - just 18 and only recently picking up the drums - suggested that he could be a good fit for the project. Following, the newly-formed two-piece played as many shows as they could in the valley. Garnering attention amongst peers, friends, and strangers alike, the two felt the impending need to round out their sound and push their creative limits, leading to the addition of husband and wife Nik and Kristen Verlennich. The final combination of the four has resulted in an original mix of lyrically-driven pop-punk bangers and ballads riddled with unexpected dissonance and bouts of noise rock. CMMNWLTH has played shows alongside Southern California's Iris Jupiter, Portland's Snow Roller, and Columbus's Saintseneca.

body.name: Titus Andronicus
body.bio: In July of 2005, the rock band Titus Andronicus made their first live appearance, performing for a few friends in an unfinished basement. The ensuing decade would see nearly 800 shows, 18 members, and the release of three full-length albums and 14 7-inches, as the group rose from their obscure beginnings in the tri-state DIY scene to the heights of international “indie stardom,” only to (nearly?) throw it all away in a vicious cycle of depression and decadence. The culmination of that ten-year journey is "The Most Lamentable Tragedy", the fourth studio album by Titus Andronicus. and the band’s debut for Merge Records. "TMLT" is the pinnacle and the missing piece, both the crown jewel of the band’s discography and the legend that contextualizes their entire body of work. It reveals that Titus Andronicus are what hardcore fans have said they are for years, and what the world must now recognize them to be: not merely the greatest rock and roll band of this era, but one of the greatest rock and roll bands of all time.

body.name: The Still Tide
body.bio: Described best as “… a little sweet spot where indie rock, shoegaze and folk rock all intersect” (Blurt Online), The Still Tide is the seasoned, luminous sound of multi-instrumentalist and songwriter Anna Morsett, co-founding member and guitarist Jacob Miller and the rhythm section of drummer Joe Richmond and bassist Nate Meese. Since leaving New York City’s jagged cityscape for their current home beneath the mountains of Denver’s skyline they’ve put out three EPs and have been hard at work touring and crafting new songs within the Colorado music scene. Their newest EP “Run Out”, the first with producer, engineer and drummer Joe Richmond (Churchill, Tennis) is out nationally on Denver record label Greater Than Collective.

body.name: jo passed
body.bio: Jo Passed is an emergent project by songwriter/vocalist/producer/multi-instrumentalist, Joseph Hirabayashi. Joseph formerly played in Vancouver based neo-psychedelic band Sprïng, which formed out of the disbanding of pronk experimental punk band, SSRIs. Jo Passed is always on tour, look for shows.

body.name: Smokey Brights
body.bio:
Smokey Brights make music that taps into history and stretches out a kind of visionary rock that rolls relentlessly forward while recombining iconic sounds - from funk to Fleetwood Mac, Bowie to Blur, disco to Dire Straits, and splashes of Floyd psychedelia - crafting something urgent, fun, and utterly surprising. The band’s driving rhythms, lusciously tight harmonies, and swirling guitar lines lay down a sumptuous, expansive 70s landscape that invites the listener to lay back, turn up, and dive deep into the depths of inner space.  

Smokey Brights are fronted by husband and wife songwriting duo Ryan Devlin (guitar, vocals) and Kim West (keys, vocals). Their North Seattle home, crammed full of thrift shop treasures and instruments, is a constant bustle of songwriting, demos, BBQs, and band practice. Song ideas are shared over coffee, sketched into notebooks strewn throughout their home, and flushed out on guitar, piano, and voice before making their way downstairs to the band’s wood-paneled practice room.

Smokey Brights’ rhythmic bedrock is laid down by the mind-melding duo of Jim Vermillion (bass) and Nick Krivchenia (drums). Best friends and brothers in rhythm for over ten years, their sonic connection is the palpable pulse that runs through the signature, Smokeys sound.

Floating deftly above this rock foundation are the unpredictable and experimental lines of guitar hero Mike Kalnoky (guitar). Pulling from a seemingly endless bag of six-string tricks, Kalnoky brings a level of experimentation to the world of Smokey Brights that makes the music both deeper and stranger, but never at the expense of song integrity.

In the six years Smokey Brights have played together, they've come to focus on the familiar and the bizarre - the spaces where the light just starts to shine through the darkness. Their music evokes that feeling of discovering a dusty record in your parents’ attic that somehow sounds new, made just for the moment you are in. Delighting in the experimentation of groove and sound, but always building upon a sturdy framework of song, Smokey Brights creates what, at times, seems lost in modern music: real songs with real meanings that elicit real feelings.

body.name: Honyock
body.bio:
Honyock formed when two brothers, Spencer and Mason Hoffman, started playing with neighborhood rapscallions Tyler Wolter and Sunshine Meinke. After going on a number of shoestring-budget tours and self releasing a few “charming” E.P.’s over the course of 5 years, the band began a process of recording every song in their increasingly eclectic repertoire with hopes of releasing a massive collection of music all at once. 16 of these recordings were tracked when, unbeknownst to the band, a mutual friend passed a selection of these songs along to Friendship Fever. 
A few months later the band was down in L.A. with producer David Vandervelde (Father John Misty, Jay Bennett) tracking a lean selection of their best material at Elliott Smith’s New Monkey Studio. The outcome of those sessions is Honyock’s forthcoming debut L.P., entitled "El Castillo", out on Friendship Fever early 2018.

body.name: Vinyl Preservation Society of Idaho
body.bio: The Vinyl Preservation Society of Idaho is an independent social organization and DJ collective that champions the analog vinyl format. Since 2007, VPS has worked to preserve and advance vinyl's place in pop culture and serve as an all-inclusive gathering place for vinyl music lovers. VPS DJs spin regularly around Boise at clubs and private parties, and the Society hosts the annual Boise Record Show and Swap in Downtown Boise.

body.name: Swatkins & The Positive Agenda
body.bio:
Swatkins is a joyful prophet of positivity. Together with his band, The Positive Agenda, he plays feel-good funk made by and for real human beings. Steve Swatkins is part of the new generation of performers making raw, fresh soulful music without relying on computers or backing tracks. This multi-instrumentalist is a master of the talkbox, an old-school analog effect using his larynx to shape the sound of his keyboard synthesizer sent through a vinyl tube. Think of the funky robot voice from "California Love" or the hair-raising harmony intro to "24 Karat Magic." Now picture a throwback dance party with a killer live band playing the deepest grooves imaginable, and you've got a taste of what The Positive Agenda is all about.  

Swatkins has long been a fixture on the touring scene in his capacity as a sideman and guest artist. As a fulltime member of Excellent Gentlemen and Juno What?! he's spread his irresistible signature style on stages across the US and Canada. Since joining Allen Stone's band in 2013, he's been around the world several times, becoming an indispensable part of the live show and co-writing several of Allen's songs, including the lead single "Upside" from Stone's latest album, Radius. Most recently, he's guest-starred with Brooklyn's Turkuaz at their debut Red Rocks performance, sat in with Vulfpeck at their biggest NYC show to date in Central Park, and has toured subbing on keyboards with modern funk legends Lettuce. Now with Steve's new original project, The Positive Agenda, his dedicated fans can see the Swatkins they know and love in a brand new setting, bringing high-energy performances to dancefloors everywhere.

body.name: Christopher Willits
body.bio:
Grammy-nominated guitarist and producer Christopher Willits occupies a unique corner of the music universe -- hovering above the intersection of electronic production's nuts and bolts and a wide-open creative mind. His tireless activity has produced over 25 albums in the last 15 years -- solo and in collaboration with artists including Ryuichi Sakamoto, Tycho, and Taylor Deupree -- and an organic, minimal sound that expands like the vines of an electro-acoustic kudzu plant. Willits is the co-founder of spatial audio / 3D sound platform Envelop as well as the creative collective Overlap, a teacher of music and mediation in San Francisco, a tech geek, a visual/new media artist, and virtuosic musician in one. Throughout, he strives to create space in which to illuminate creativity and catalyze inner change.

In Willits' music, all elements are interconnected; voice and guitar lines fold into bleary, unrecognizable shapes and polyrhythmic textures, often overlapping with his own cinematic film and video work. This widescreen approach grows more immersive and innovative with each release. A full list of his critically acclaimed catalog would take up considerable column space, but a beginner's guide to Willits includes 2002's Folding, and the Tea (his debut on 12k), 2006's landmark Surf Boundaries (his first full-length on Ghostly International), 2008's Ocean Fire (Willits' collaboration with renowned pianist / composer Ryuichi Sakamoto), 2010's Tiger Flower Circle Sun (a study on universal vibrations), 2012's Ancient Future (his second album with Sakamoto), and the audiovisual LP Opening recorded with the whole band of Tycho in 2014.

body.name: Up is the Down is the

song.artist_name: Up is the Down is the
song.title: Forward 6pm 9_17_2017 Mp3

body.bio: Boise, ID based indie electronic "Up is the Down is the" is headed by multi-instrumentalist Andrew Martin. He released his R&B influenced album "Memory" in 2015. "Radiate" from that album was added as the theme song for Boise State Public Radio's "Some of the parts". He is currently finishing an untitled full length album to release in 2018.

body.name: The Muckers
body.bio: The Muckers is a collage of every sound that you’ve ever heard in your life! From Psych Rock to Funk to Garage and Punk

body.name: Henry Canyons
body.bio:
LA based rapper, Henry Canyons, transcends your typical boundaries of hip-hop identity. The half-French, Brooklyn native draws from his diverse cultural background which directly reflects on his musical style.  On his first album Canyonland, Henry and Paris’ Keor Meteor teamed up on a jazzy, boom bap-centric and introspective record guaranteed to leave listeners quenched with a refreshing cocktail of soulful hip-hop. In 2016, Berlin based Jakarta Records re-released Canylonland on limited edition vinyl that sold out in a matter of hours.  In September of 2016, Canyons participated in a two month artist residency at BoiSakré Productions in Biarritz, France which resulted in La Côte West EP inspired by his experience in Europe.  La Côte West, released on January 1, 2018 on Brooklyn-based label Backwoodz Studioz, and recently made Bandcamp's Best Hip-Hop of January 2018 list. 

 On stage, it is Henry’s electric energy, command over the crowd, and ability to control his SP 404 while simultaneously rapping that proves that he is a one man spectacle. Over the course of his career Canyons has shared the stage with Macklemore, Tash (Tha Alkaholiks), Open Mike Eagle, Homeboy Sandman, Pigeon Jon, Blue Scholars, Billy Woods, Illogic, and tons of local LA talent.

body.name: Band Dialogue VII
body.bio:
Composed and Conducted by Seth Olinsky 

“THERE'S NO HYPERBOLE THAT COULD ADEQUATELY DESCRIBE THE SHEER SENSORY ASSAULT. IT EVOKED THE SCALE OF POST ROCK EXPERIMENTS SUCH AS THE BOREDOMS' 77 AND 88 BOADRUM EVENT GATHERINGS, BUT ACCOMPLISHED SOMETHING MORE JOYOUS AND PROFOUND: A CONVERSATION, NOT JUST A SHARED TRANCE. IT WAS EPIC. IT WAS EXHILARATING. IT WAS BEAUTIFUL.“ - OREGON LIVE 

Band Dialogue is a massive composition, experiment, and conversation that explores the sonics of many bands, stretched out across a space, playing simultaneously, part orchestra, part installation. Continuing in the lineage of large scale guitar and drum events by the likes of NYC composer Rhys Chatham and Osaka noise lords Boredoms, each version is adapted to the site and bands for something totally unique - bands radiate their individual glory while simultaneously expanding into one colossal sound. 

Band Dialogue is a piece I started imagining in 2012 and composed the first version of in 2013 for Hopscotch Music Festival with the production help of Martin Anderson and Tina Haver Currin helping me pull off the crazy idea the first time. Since then I have been lucky to do it at Treefort Music Fest and Sled Island as well as Hopscotch, which I think are 3 of the coolest music festivals in North America right now. All with their own individual, artistic voice, but sharing a focus on music and community which for me is what Band Dialogue is all about. Every year the piece keeps getting different, bigger, and LOUDER and I've met an amazing amount of incredible musicians, discovered new bands, and made new friends. 

“FOR MANY, THE HIGHLIGHT OF THE FESTIVAL CAME ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AT BAND DIALOGUE III, WHERE SETH OLINSKY OF AKRON/FAMILY, WHO WAS PERFORMING AT TREEFORT UNDER THE MONIKER OF HIS SIDE-PROJECT CY DUNE, TOOK ON THE ROLE OF COMPOSER AND CONDUCTOR IN LEADING A DOZEN FULL BANDS IN A MASSIVE ORCHESTRA THAT LINED BOTH SIDES OF A CLOSED OFF CITY BLOCK. OLINSKY USED CUE CARDS TO GIVE THE BANDS CHORD PROGRESSIONS, AND HIS BACK AND FORTH COMMANDS TRIGGERED BANDS, INSTRUMENTS, AND ALTERNATING SIDES OF THE STREET, CREATING A SWEEPING WHIRLWIND OF SOUND THAT WASHED OVER EVERYTHING IN THE SURROUNDING AREA.“ - PORTLAND MERCURY 


MUSICIANS THAT HAVE PARTICIPATED IN BAND DIALOGUE I - VI include: 

Delicate Steve, Disco Doom, Sun Blood Stories, The Western Mystics, Cy Dune, Ali Beletic, Dana Buoy, Tuft, Animal Eyes, Invisible Hand, Religious Girls, AU, AAN, Built to Spill, American Culture, Marshall Poole, C.J. Boyd, HiHazel, Tuft, Battlehooch, Unconditional Arms, Sugar Candy Mountain, Terrible Light, Hi Hazel, Andrew Barker, Tim Dahl, Greg Fox, Pontiak, Hi Ho Silver Oh, Jamaican Queens, Dead Soft, Stepmothers, Outlaws of Ravenhurst, WHOOP-Szo, The FAPS, Brother Prussia, MILK (band), Chick Magnets, 36?, Daniel McCormak, Windigo, Raleigh, matt doherty, Hexray, Saxsyndrum, Ohioan, Twin Steps, Inner Oceans, Wooden Indian Burial Ground, Sama Dams, Art Fad, Godspeed You! Black Emperor, Benjamin Pacheco, Mike Horick, Bill Pfeifer.

body.name: Clowning Workshop with Kelly Anne Barker
body.bio: The Red Nose Mask - Join Kelly Anne Barker in a clowning workshop where we will learn to laugh at ourselves and use our imaginations! All ages and families are encouraged find their inner clown together through discovering our clown bodies and names, as well as play improvisation games. Clowning requires an incredible amount of boldness, sensitivity and inventiveness so bring everything you've got to earn your red nose.

body.name: Federale
body.bio: Federale is a seven-piece ensemble based in Portland, OR. Spearheaded by longtime Brian Jonestown Massacre bassist Collin Hegna, the band was conceived as an outlet to channel inspiration from ‘60s & ‘70s European soundtracks, particularly those from Italy made famous by the Spaghetti Western & Giallo genres.

body.name: Emma Arnold
body.bio: Emma Arnold is America's fiercest sweetheart. Equal parts outrageous and thoughtful, her standup comedy is engaging, honest, and comes from the heart. Emma once followed a eulogy at the Limestone Comedy Festival, after which, Bobcat Goldthwait told her he’d never seen anyone do what she does. In addition to being a successful touring comedian, Emma is a third generation beekeeper and honey farmer. She is the cofounder and artistic director of the 208 Comedyfest, as well as the codirector of Comedyfort (part of the Treefort Festival), and her debut comedy album, "Shut Up, Calvin" is available from Rooftop Comedy. When not touring, Emma lives in Idaho, where she keeps kids and bees with varying degrees of success.
